descript.abstract: This polygon feature class represents vegetation burn severity calibrated to the Composite Burn Index (CBI) for selected fires in California.
descript.purpose: These data were created by the USDA Forest Service fire and fuels monitoring project to support monitoring of wildland fire and fire regimes. These data will allow better understanding of current fire regimes, improve the accuracy of fire perimeter data, and add spatial data on fire severity and complexity.
descript.supplinf:
These data are derived from Landsat Thematic Mapper imagery. The pre-fire and post-fire subscenes were used to create a Relative Differenced Normalized Burn Ratio (RdNBR). The RdNBR is correlated to the variation of burn severity within a fire. The RdNBR data are calibrated with the Composite Burn Index (CBI). The severity ratings provided by the derived products listed below are based on the severity to vegetation.
For a description of RdNBR see:
Miller, J.D. and Thode, A.E. (2007). Quantifying burn severity in a heterogeneous landscape with a relative version of the delta Normalized Burn Ratio(dNBR). Remote Sensing of Environment 109(1):66-80.
For a description of the calibration of RdNBR to severity measures see:
Miller, J.D., Knapp, E.E., Key, C.H., Skinner, C.N., Isbell, C.J., Creasy, R.M. and Sherlock, J.W. (2009). Calibration and validation of the relative differenced Normalized Burn Ratio (RdNBR) to three measures of fire severity in the Sierra Nevada and Klamath Mountains, California, USA. Remote Sensing of Environment 113(3): 645-656.
Miller, J.D. and Quayle, B. (2015). Calibration and validation of immediate post-fire satellite derived data to three severity metrics. Fire Ecology 11(2): 12-30.
This database may contain more than one assessment for each fire: initial and/or extended. Initial assessement data can differ from extended assessment data because: 1.) The calibrations used to derive the severity data are based on one year post-fire field data. Calibrations for Initial assessments were derived through regression modeling of satellite reflectance values from imagery collected one year post-fire to imagery acquired immediate post-fire. 2.) Imagery used to make initial assessments are acquired immediately after containment which can be late in the year when sun angles are low due to fire containment dates and therefore fire effects on north facing slopes can be hidden due to topographic shadows caused by low sun angles causing high severity fire effects in these data to be under represented. Low to moderate severity in dense stands on east, west or south aspects may also be under-represented due to a low sun illumination angle. 3.) Imagery used for extended assessments are acquired the year after the fire occurred and can therefore include effects due to resprouting vegetation, delayed mortality of trees, and any management actions that have taken place between the fire containment date and image acquisition date.

idinfo.useconst: There are no restrictions on use, except for reasonable and proper acknowledgement of information sources.

cntorgp.cntorg: USDA Forest Service, Pacific Southwest Region, Fire and Aviation Mgmt.

citeinfo.origin: USDA Forest Service, Pacific Southwest Region, Fire and Aviation Mgmt.
citeinfo.title: VegBurnSeverity

dataqual.logic: Satellite data for initial assessments may have been acquired before final containment. Therefore additional fire effects may have occurred after satellite acquisition date. See metadata for dates of satellite imagery. The user should reconcile dates with fire containment dates before use. Data used for initial assessments may be acquired by more than one satellite due to lack of satellite availability. When Landsat TM data are available intial assessments are based upon the NBR index, otherwise the assessments are based upon NDVI. See the metadata for each fire to determine imagery used in the assessement.

procstep.procdesc: Version 10_3 includes updates for fires 200-1000 ac in size that occured in the Sierra Nevada during 1984-2009, and extended assessments for 2009 fires for all of Region 5 Forests. Added the VB_ID field to link the perimeters to the severity data records.

Version 11_2 fixed BEST_ASSESS values for 2011 fires. Changed values from NO to YES. The 2011 initial assessments are the only assessements available at this time and therefore are the best available.

Version 12_1 includes updates to existing and additional new fires: 1985 GORDA_RAT, 1985 SECO, 1985 USF05071985000999, 1989 MOLERA2, 1992 SECO, 1992 USF05071992000032, 2000 PLASKETT2, 2007 HAWKEN, 2010 BAR, 2010 BODFISH, 2010 BUCKHORN, 2010 BULL, 2010 BULLARDS, 2010 CANYON, 2010 CONSTANTIA, 2010 MONO, 2010 MONTE, 2010 PINECREST, 2010 POST, 2010 POZO, 2010 SHEEP, 2010 WOLF_CREEK, 2011 ANNIE, 2011 BUTTERMILK, 2011 HILL, 2011 MAMMOTH, 2011 ONION, 2011 SCORPION, 2011 WILLOWS, 2012 BEAR, 2012 CHIPS, 2012 FLAT, 2012 GEORGE, 2012 MILL, 2012 READING, 2012 SALT_CREEK
Version 12_2 includes new 2012 fires: Barry Point, Bagley, Ramsey, Stafford, Williams, Goff, North Pass
Version 13_1 added initial assessments for 5 older fires, 2002 Showers, 2004 Deep, 2004 Sims, 2004 Straylor, 2005 Harding, Set "BEST_ASSESS" to YES for 2004 Deep initial assessment.

Version 14_1 added initial assessments for 13 2013 fires and 4 older fires: 2010 BRIGGS, 2011 MINT, 2011 BRECKENRIDGE COMPLEX, 2011 COVE, 2013 AMERICAN, 2013 ASPEN, 2013 BUTLER, 2013 CARSTENS, 2013 CORRAL CMPLX, 2013 FISH, 2013 HATHAWAY, 2013 MOUNTAIN, 2013 PANTHER, 2013 POWERHOUSE, 2013 RIM, 2013 SALMON RIVER CMPLX, 2013 SILVER

Version 14_2: Migrated personal geodatabase to file geodatabase: Masked out lakes in 2012 Reading initial assessment; Added initial assessment for 2000 Storrie; Added extended assessment for 2010 Bar; Added extended assessments for 17 fires on USFS lands in 2012: Bagley, Barry Point, Bear, Chips, Clear, Flat, George, Goff, Mill, Mill, North Pass, Peak, Ramsey, Reading, Salt Creek, Stafford, Williams; Added 113 wildfires greater than 200 acres in four National Parks: Lassen, Yosemite, Sequoia and Kings Canyon

Version 15_1: Added initial assessments for 2013 fires: Chariot, Deer, Falls, Grand, Ridge/Heights, Summit, White, Windy Peak. Initial assessments for 2013 Corral Complex and 2013 Panther were reprocessed to reflect final perimeters. Added extended assessments for 2013 fires: Butler, Corral Complex, Kyburz, Panther, Ridge/Heights, Salmon River Cmplx, Shirley, Windy Peak.

Version 16_1: THIS VERSION CONTAINS NEW FIRES AND/OR ASSESSMENTS AT THE REQUEST OF CALFIRE AS WELL AS NEW AND UPDATED USFS AND NPS FIRES NEW INITIAL ASSESSMENTS: 1999: CANYON #4, DOE MILL, ELEANOR, FIRE #3, JUNIPER, LECONTE, LOST BEAR, LOWDEN, MUSTY, SOUTH, WOODLAND 2000: CONCOW, GOAT, HAPPY, MORGAN, NORTH FORK 2001: LEONARD, PONDEROSA 2002: CROY, FIELD, PALISADE, WOLF 2003: ANNIE, CANOE, DEVIL, HONEYDEW, KINKAID, MOUNTAIN, TUOLUMNE, OLD/GRANDPRIX/PADUA, WHISKEY, WHITMORE 2004: BLUFF, GATOS, HWY 4 #2, IRONGATE, KINCAID, OLD HWY/MPUD 149, MEADOW WFU, OREGON, PATTISON, RUMSEY, STEVENS 2005: 36, BAILEY, HALLORAN, MILLWOOD, TOVEY, WAPAMA, WILDHORSE 2006: COTTONWOOD, CREEK INCIDENT, ESPERANZA, FROG, JUNCTION, NOBLE, PUSHWALLA, RICO, SAGE, SAWTOOTH COMPLEX, WHISPERING PINES 2007: LICK, LOS FLORES, POWER, TAR, WHITE 2008: BUTCH, CLIFF RIDGE, COWSHED LIGHTNING, CRAIG, HARDY CREEK LIGHTNING, HIDDEN, HUMBOLDT, INDIAN, JACK SMITH, KIRKMAN, LOST PIPE, LOW GAP, LOWER, MIDDLE, MOON, NAVAROO, ORR SERIES, PARADISE, PINE 2, RED MOUNTAIN LIGHTNING, SUGARLOAF, SUMMIT, TRAVIS 1, TWENTY, WILD 2009: BRYSON, COFFIN, GROUSE, HARDEN, LOCKHEED, WILDCAT, YUBA 2010: SLOPE, VERNON, WEST 2011: BAKER, BLACK, CANYON, INDIAN, STAGE 2012: CASCADE, CLEAR, DALE, JAWBONE BRANCH, LAKE, LIKLEY, MILL, PONDEROSA, RIM BRANCH, ROBBERS, RUSH, SIXTEEN COMPLEX, WYE 2013: CLOVER, DELUZ, MCCABE, SWEDES 2014: COLBY, GULCH, WAY 2015: BARKER, BEAR, BLUE, BUCK, BUTTE, CABIN, CASTLE, COON, FROG, GOBBLER, JOHNSON, LAKE, LASSIC, NICKOWITZ, PATTISON, PEAK (SRF), PEAK (SHF), PICKETT, PINE, RAIL, RIVER COMPLEX, ROUND, ROUGH, SADDLE, SHIELL, TASSAJARA, VALLEY, WALKER, WASHINGTON
NEW EXTENDED ASSESSMENTS: 1999: CANYON #4, DOE MILL, FIRE #3, JUNIPER, LOWDEN, MUSTY, SOUTH, WOODLAND 2000: CONCOW, GOAT, HAPPY, MORGAN 2001: LEONARD, PONDEROSA 2002: CROY 2003: ANNIE, CANOE, DEVIL, HONEYDEW, MOUNTAIN, WHITMORE 2004: GATOS, IRONGATE, KINCAID, OLD HWY/MPUD 149, OREGON, RUMSEY, STEVENS 2005: 36, BAILEY 2006: COTTONWOOD, CREEK INCIDENT, ESPERANZA, JUNCTION, NOBLE, PUSHWALLA, SAGE, SAWTOOTH COMPLEX, WHISPERING PINES 2007: LICK, LOS FLORES, POWER, TAR, WHITE 2008: BUTCH, CLIFF RIDGE, COWSHED LIGHTNING, CRAIG, HARDY CREEK LIGHTNING, INDIAN, LOST PIPE, LOW GAP, LOWER, MIDDLE, MOON, NAVAROO, ORR SERIES, PARADISE, PINE 2, RED MOUNTAIN LIGHTNING, SUGARLOAF, SUMMIT, TRAVIS 1 2009: COFFIN, LOCKHEED, YUBA 2012: DALE, JAWBONE BRANCH, PONDEROSA, RIM BRANCH, ROBBERS 2013: SWEDES 2014: CAMPBELL, COURTNEY, DARK HOLE, MEADOW, SHIRLEY
UPDATED: 2003: OLD/GRANDPRIX/PADUA 2004: MEADOW WFU 2006: FROG 2009: GROUSE, HARDEN, WILDCAT 2012: CLEAR, MILL, STAFFORD 2013: CHARIOT, GRAND 2014: SODA

Version 17_1:
THIS VERSION CONTAINS NEW FIRES AND/OR ASSESSMENTS AT THE REQUEST OF CALFIRE AS WELL AS NEW AND UPDATED USFS AND NPS FIRES NEW INITIAL ASSESSMENTS: 2014: LODGE COMPLEX, OREGON GULCH, SAND 2015: CUESTA, HIGHWAY, JERUSALEM, LOWELL, LUMPKIN, NORTH, PARKHILL, ROCKY, SKY, STEELHEAD, WRAGG 2016: BLUECUT, CEDAR, CLARK, ERSKINE, FISH, GAP, JACOBSON, OWENS RIVER, PILOT, PINE, PONY, REY, SACATA, SAND, SOBERANES, SOUP COMPLEX, TRAILHEAD
NEW EXTENDED ASSESSMENTS: 2014: LODGE COMPLEX, OREGON GULCH, SAND 2015: BARKER, BEAR, BIG CREEK, BIG FIVE, BLUE, BUCK, BUTTE, CABIN, CASTLE (SOUTH COMPLEX), COON, CORRINE, CUESTA, FROG, GOBBLER, HIGHWAY, JERUSALEM, JOHNSON (ROUTE COMPLEX), LAKE, LASSIC, LOWELL, LUMPKIN, MIDDLE, NICKOWITZ, PARKHILL, PATTISON (SOUTH COMPLEX), PEAK (SHF), PEAK (SRF), PICKETT, PINE, RAIL, RIVER COMPLEX, ROCKY, ROUGH, SADDLE, SHIELL, SKY, STEELHEAD, TASSAJARA, TENAYA, WASHINGTON, WILLOW, WRAGG

distinfo.distliab: Distribution_Liability This product is reproduced from geospatial information prepared by the U.S. Department of Agriculture, Forest Service. By removing the contents of this package or taking receipt of these files via electronic file transfer methods, you understand that the data stored on this media is in draft condition. Represented features may not be in an accurate geographic location. The Forest Service makes no expressed or implied warranty, including warranty of merchantability and fitness, with respect to the character, function, or capabilities of the data or their appropriateness for any user's purposes. The Forest Service reserves the right to correct, update, modify, or replace this geospatial information without notification.

dataIdInfo.suppInfo:
These data are derived from Landsat Thematic Mapper imagery. The pre-fire and post-fire subscenes were used to create a Relative Differenced Normalized Burn Ratio (RdNBR). The RdNBR is correlated to the variation of burn severity within a fire. The RdNBR data are calibrated with the Composite Burn Index (CBI). The severity ratings provided by the derived products listed below are based on the severity to vegetation.
For a description of RdNBR see:
Miller, J.D. and Thode, A.E. (2007). Quantifying burn severity in a heterogeneous landscape with a relative version of the delta Normalized Burn Ratio(dNBR). Remote Sensing of Environment 109(1):66-80.
For a description of the calibration of RdNBR to severity measures see:
Miller, J.D., Knapp, E.E., Key, C.H., Skinner, C.N., Isbell, C.J., Creasy, R.M. and Sherlock, J.W. (2009). Calibration and validation of the relative differenced Normalized Burn Ratio (RdNBR) to three measures of fire severity in the Sierra Nevada and Klamath Mountains, California, USA. Remote Sensing of Environment 113(3): 645-656.
Miller, J.D. and Quayle, B. (2015). Calibration and validation of immediate post-fire satellite derived data to three severity metrics. Fire Ecology 11(2): 12-30.
This database may contain more than one assessment for each fire: initial and/or extended. Initial assessement data can differ from extended assessment data because: 1.) The calibrations used to derive the severity data are based on one year post-fire field data. Calibrations for Initial assessments were derived through regression modeling of satellite reflectance values from imagery collected one year post-fire to imagery acquired immediate post-fire. 2.) Imagery used to make initial assessments are acquired immediately after containment which can be late in the year when sun angles are low due to fire containment dates and therefore fire effects on north facing slopes can be hidden due to topographic shadows caused by low sun angles causing high severity fire effects in these data to be under represented. Low to moderate severity in dense stands on east, west or south aspects may also be under-represented due to a low sun illumination angle. 3.) Imagery used for extended assessments are acquired the year after the fire occurred and can therefore include effects due to resprouting vegetation, delayed mortality of trees, and any management actions that have taken place between the fire containment date and image acquisition date.

lineage.Process: FeatureClassToFeatureClass "VegBurnSeverity 14_1 initial" D:\arcws\vegseverity\VegBurnSeverity14_2.gdb VegBurnSeverity # "BURNSEV "BURNSEV" true true false 2 Short 0 0 ,First,#,D:\arcws\vegseverity\VegBurnSeverity14_1.mdb\VegBurnSeverity,BURNSEV,-1,-1;ASSESS_TYPE "ASSESS_TYPE" true true false 1 Text 0 0 ,First,#,D:\arcws\vegseverity\VegBurnSeverity14_1.mdb\VegBurnSeverity,ASSESS_TYPE,-1,-1;BEST_ASSESS "BEST_ASSESS" true true false 3 Text 0 0 ,First,#,D:\arcws\vegseverity\VegBurnSeverity14_1.mdb\VegBurnSeverity,BEST_ASSESS,-1,-1;FIRE_YEAR "FIRE_YEAR" true true false 4 Text 0 0 ,First,#,D:\arcws\vegseverity\VegBurnSeverity14_1.mdb\VegBurnSeverity,FIRE_YEAR,-1,-1;VB_ID "VB_ID" true true false 34 Text 0 0 ,First,#,D:\arcws\vegseverity\VegBurnSeverity14_1.mdb\VegBurnSeverity,VB_ID,-1,-1;Shape_Length "Shape_Length" false true true 8 Double 0 0 ,First,#,D:\arcws\vegseverity\VegBurnSeverity14_1.mdb\VegBurnSeverity,Shape_Length,-1,-1;Shape_Area "Shape_Area" false true true 8 Double 0 0 ,First,#,D:\arcws\vegseverity\VegBurnSeverity14_1.mdb\VegBurnSeverity,Shape_Area,-1,-1" #
Buffer High_Sev12_16 C:\Users\zlsteel\repos\reforest_tool\data\Spatial\HS200.shp "-200 Meters" FULL ROUND NONE # PLANAR

prcStep.stepDesc: Version 10_3 includes updates for fires 200-1000 ac in size that occured in the Sierra Nevada during 1984-2009, and extended assessments for 2009 fires for all of Region 5 Forests. Added the VB_ID field to link the perimeters to the severity data records.

Version 11_2 fixed BEST_ASSESS values for 2011 fires. Changed values from NO to YES. The 2011 initial assessments are the only assessements available at this time and therefore are the best available.

Version 12_1 includes updates to existing and additional new fires: 1985 GORDA_RAT, 1985 SECO, 1985 USF05071985000999, 1989 MOLERA2, 1992 SECO, 1992 USF05071992000032, 2000 PLASKETT2, 2007 HAWKEN, 2010 BAR, 2010 BODFISH, 2010 BUCKHORN, 2010 BULL, 2010 BULLARDS, 2010 CANYON, 2010 CONSTANTIA, 2010 MONO, 2010 MONTE, 2010 PINECREST, 2010 POST, 2010 POZO, 2010 SHEEP, 2010 WOLF_CREEK, 2011 ANNIE, 2011 BUTTERMILK, 2011 HILL, 2011 MAMMOTH, 2011 ONION, 2011 SCORPION, 2011 WILLOWS, 2012 BEAR, 2012 CHIPS, 2012 FLAT, 2012 GEORGE, 2012 MILL, 2012 READING, 2012 SALT_CREEK
Version 12_2 includes new 2012 fires: Barry Point, Bagley, Ramsey, Stafford, Williams, Goff, North Pass
Version 13_1 added initial assessments for 5 older fires, 2002 Showers, 2004 Deep, 2004 Sims, 2004 Straylor, 2005 Harding, Set "BEST_ASSESS" to YES for 2004 Deep initial assessment.

Version 14_1 added initial assessments for 13 2013 fires and 4 older fires: 2010 BRIGGS, 2011 MINT, 2011 BRECKENRIDGE COMPLEX, 2011 COVE, 2013 AMERICAN, 2013 ASPEN, 2013 BUTLER, 2013 CARSTENS, 2013 CORRAL CMPLX, 2013 FISH, 2013 HATHAWAY, 2013 MOUNTAIN, 2013 PANTHER, 2013 POWERHOUSE, 2013 RIM, 2013 SALMON RIVER CMPLX, 2013 SILVER

Version 15_1: Added initial assessments for 2013 fires: Chariot, Deer, Falls, Grand, Ridge/Heights, Summit, White, Windy Peak. Initial assessments for 2013 Corral Complex and 2013 Panther were reprocessed to reflect final perimeters. Added extended assessments for 2013 fires: Butler, Corral Complex, Kyburz, Panther, Ridge/Heights, Salmon River Cmplx, Shirley, Windy Peak.
